query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Al fine de le sue parole il ladro 2 le mani alzò con amendue le fiche, 3 gridando: «Togli, Dio, ch’a te le squadro!».
query.error: **English:** 1 At the end of his words, the thief 2 raised his hands with both his figs, 3 shouting: "Take that, God, that I shake at you!"
query.result: 1 Tasya vacanānte cauraḥ 2 Ubhe haste mudrābhyāṃ kṛtvā 3 Uvāca: "Gṛhāṇa, Deva, yattubhyaṃ darśayāmi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 Da indi in qua mi fuor le serpi amiche, 5 perch’ una li s’avvolse allora al collo, 6 come dicesse ‘Non vo’ che più diche’;
query.error: **English:** 4 From there on, the serpents were friendly to me, 5 because one of them then coiled itself around my neck, 6 as if to say, ‘I do not want you to speak any more’;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 e un’altra a le braccia, e rilegollo, 8 ribadendo sé stessa sì dinanzi, 9 che non potea con esse dare un crollo.
query.error: **English:** 7 and another one around my arms, and bound me, 8 winding itself in front of me so tightly 9 that I could not move with them.
query.result: 7 anyaś ca mama bāhubhyāṃ, tataś ca mama hastau badhnāti sma, 8 punaḥ punaḥ ātmānam eva puras tataḥ parivartayan, 9 yena saha na śaknomi tena saha ekaṃ api calaṃ kartum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Ahi Pistoia, Pistoia, ché non stanzi 11 d’incenerarti sì che più non duri, 12 poi che ’n mal fare il seme tuo avanzi?
query.error: **English:** 10 Ah, Pistoia, Pistoia, why do you not 11 burn yourself to ashes so that you may no longer endure, 12 since your seed advances in evil-doing?
query.result: 10 Aha Piṣṭapura, Piṣṭapura, kimartham na tiṣṭhasi 11 ātmānaṃ dagdhavā yathā na sthāsyasi, 12 yasmāt pāpa-karmaṇi tava bījam abhivardhate?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Per tutt’ i cerchi de lo ’nferno scuri 14 non vidi spirto in Dio tanto superbo, 15 non quel che cadde a Tebe giù da’ muri.
query.error: **English:** 13 Through all the dark circles of hell 14 I saw no spirit so proud in God, 15 not even the one who fell from the walls down to Thebes.
query.result: 13 Sarveṣu narakānāṃ cakreṣu andhakāreṣu 14 na apaśyam ātmānaṃ Devasya tāvad abhimāninaṃ, 15 na ca tam yaḥ patitaḥ āsīt Tebeḥ prākāreभ्यḥ अधः.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 El si fuggì che non parlò più verbo; 17 e io vidi un centauro pien di rabbia 18 venir chiamando: «Ov’ è, ov’ è l’acerbo?».
query.error: **English:** 16 He fled so that he spoke no more a word; 17 and I saw a centaur full of rage 18 coming, calling out: "Where is he, where is the fierce one?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Maremma non cred’ io che tante n’abbia, 20 quante bisce elli avea su per la groppa 21 infin ove comincia nostra labbia.
query.error: **English:** 19 I don't believe the Maremma has so many, 20 as many snakes as he had on his back, 21 right up to where our face begins.
query.result: 19 Maremma na manye aham yāvatīḥ asti, 20 tāvatīr viṣakṛmir āsīt tasya pṛṣṭhe, 21 yāvad ārabhate asmākam vaktram.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Sovra le spalle, dietro da la coppa, 23 con l’ali aperte li giacea un draco; 24 e quello affuoca qualunque s’intoppa.
query.error: **English:** 22 Over his shoulders, behind the nape, 23 with open wings, a dragon lay upon him; 24 and he sets fire to whomever he encounters.
query.result: 22 Skandhayoh paścāt grīvāyāḥ upari, 23 Vikaṭair vikasitair api pakṣaiḥ saṃyuktaḥ sarpaḥ śete sma, 24 Sa ca yaḥ kaścid enam āpnoti, tam sa dagdhavān.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Lo mio maestro disse: «Questi è Caco, 26 che, sotto ’l sasso di monte Aventino, 27 di sangue fece spesse volte laco.
query.error: **English:** 25 My master said: "This is Cacus, 26 who, beneath the rock of Aventine Mount, 27 often made a pool of blood.
query.result: 25 Mamaivaśiṣyaḥuvāca: "AyaṃCakaḥ, 26 Yaḥ, Aventinaśailasyaadhaḥ, 27 Raktasyapoṣaṃbahuśaḥakārṣīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Non va co’ suoi fratei per un cammino, 29 per lo furto che frodolente fece 30 del grande armento ch’elli ebbe a vicino;
query.error: **English:** 28 He does not go with his brothers on a journey, 29 because of the treacherous theft he committed 30 of the great herd that he had nearby;
query.result: 28 Na sa svabhrātṛbhiḥ sahaikamārgaṃgacchati, 29 Mahāpaśūnāṃharaṇāttadvañcanāt, 30 Ye tasyaāsannāsamaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 onde cessar le sue opere biece 32 sotto la mazza d’Ercule, che forse 33 gliene diè cento, e non sentì le diece».
query.error: **English:** 31 therefore his wicked deeds ceased 32 under the club of Hercules, who perhaps 33 gave him a hundred blows, and he did not feel ten of them.
query.result: 31 Tasmāttasyapapakarmasāmakarṣaṇāt 32 Harergaḍāyāṃnivartitāni,yena 33 Śataṃdadau,na tu daśaivedānajānāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Mentre che sì parlava, ed el trascorse, 35 e tre spiriti venner sotto noi, 36 de’ quai né io né ’l duca mio s’accorse,
query.error: **English:** 34 While he was speaking thus, and he passed on, 35 and three spirits came beneath us, 36 whom neither I nor my leader noticed,
query.result: 34 Yāvad ayam evam abhāṣata, sa ca atijagāma, 35 tataś ca adhastād asmākam ājagmuḥ trayaḥ ātmānaḥ, 36 yeṣām na aham na ca mama netā ajānatām,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 se non quando gridar: «Chi siete voi?»; 38 per che nostra novella si ristette, 39 e intendemmo pur ad essi poi.
query.error: **English:** 37 except when they cried out: "Who are you?" 38 because of which our story was interrupted, 39 and we only understood them afterwards.
query.result: 37 vinā tadā yadā ājagmuḥ: "Ke vayam bhavataḥ?" iti, 38 yena asmākam kathā niṣṭhita, 39 tataś ca paścāt tebhyaḥ eva avagamyatām asmābhiḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Io non li conoscea; ma ei seguette, 41 come suol seguitar per alcun caso, 42 che l’un nomar un altro convenette,
query.error: **English:** 40 I did not know them; but I followed them, 41 as one is wont to follow by chance, 42 when one must call to another,
query.result: 40 Aham na jānāmi tāvat; api tu anugacchāmi, 41 yathā kaścid api anugacchati kākena api kāraṇena, 42 yadā ekaḥ ekena saha samvaditum icchati,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 dicendo: «Cianfa dove fia rimaso?»; 44 per ch’io, acciò che ’l duca stesse attento, 45 mi puosi ’l dito su dal mento al naso.
query.error: **English:** 43 saying: "Cianfa, where will he have remained?" 44 Because of which, so that the leader would pay attention, 45 I placed my finger up from my chin to my nose.
query.result: 43 evam uktavān: "Cianfa, katham ayam sthāsyati?" 44 Yasmāt, yathā duḥśīlaḥ śṛṇuyāt, 45 aṅgulim adhārayataḥ nāsikāparyantam sthāpayām āsa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Se tu se’ or, lettore, a creder lento 47 ciò ch’io dirò, non sarà maraviglia, 48 ché io che ’l vidi, a pena il mi consento.
query.error: **English:** 46 If you are now, reader, slow to believe 47 what I shall tell, it will not be a wonder, 48 for I who saw it, hardly can assent to it.
query.result: 46 Yadi tvam asi adya, vācaka, viśvasane śīghraḥ, 47 yat aham vakṣyāmi, na bhaviṣyati āścaryaṃ, 48 yataḥ aham yaḥ tad adṛkṣam, sāmpratam api kaumāraṃ tasmai karomi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Com’ io tenea levate in lor le ciglia, 50 e un serpente con sei piè si lancia 51 dinanzi a l’uno, e tutto a lui s’appiglia.
query.error: **English:** 49 As I kept my gaze fixed on them, 50 a serpent with six feet darted out 51 in front of one of them, and clung to it entirely.
query.result: 49 Yathā aham teṣu dṛṣṭim udvāhitām adadhām, 50 ṣaḍbhiḥ pādaiḥ sarpaḥ ekaḥ pradhāvati, 51 tasyaikasya agre, tasmiñca pūrṇataḥ āśliṣyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 li diretani a le cosce distese, 56 e miseli la coda tra ’mbedue 57 e dietro per le ren sù la ritese.
query.error: **English:** 55 he stretched his hind feet along his thighs, 56 and put his tail between them both, 57 and stuck it up along his loins behind.
query.result: 55 Janghābhyām ūru-dvayam vistārya, 56 Pṛṣṭhe ca pūrvāṃ pucchaṃ nyadadhāt, 57 Tato nija-kaṭyāṃ pṛṣṭhataḥ prāviśat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Ellera abbarbicata mai non fue 59 ad alber sì, come l’orribil fiera 60 per l’altrui membra avviticchiò le sue.
query.error: **English:** 58 Ivy so entwined was never seen 59 on tree, as was the horrible beast 60 that with another's limbs enwrapped its own.
query.result: 58 Elleraḥ samśliṣṭā kadācinna bhūtā 59 Vṛkṣe yathā ghoraḥ paśuḥ 60 Parakāyair āvṛṇoti svakāyān.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Poi s’appiccar, come di calda cera 62 fossero stati, e mischiar lor colore, 63 né l’un né l’altro già parea quel ch’era:
query.error: **English:** 61 Then they stuck together, as if they were made of hot wax, 62 and mixed their colors, 63 neither of them seeming to be what it was before:
query.result: 61 Tataḥ saṃśliṣṭau bhavataḥ, yathā uṣṇasya mṛdvikāyāḥ, 62 abhūtām, miśritau ca abhavatām tau varṇau, 63 na ca ekaḥ na ca anyaḥ abhūn naḥ pūrvaḥ yaḥ:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 come procede innanzi da l’ardore, 65 per lo papiro suso, un color bruno 66 che non è nero ancora e ’l bianco more.
query.error: **English:** 64 as a brown color advances before the heat, 65 over the papyrus, a color that is not yet black and the white dies.
query.result: 64 yathā agre vartate dahati, 65 papirasya upari, varṇaḥ kaścana kṛṣṇaḥ, 66 yaḥ na kṛṣṇaḥ eva asti, śuklaḥ ca mriyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Li altri due ’l riguardavano, e ciascuno 68 gridava: «Omè, Agnel, come ti muti! 69 Vedi che già non se’ né due né uno».
query.error: **English:** 67 The other two looked at him, and each one 68 cried out: "Oh me, Agnello, how you change! 69 See that you are now neither two nor one."
query.result: 67 Anye dve tau tam apaśyan, ekaikaśca 68 āha: "Aha, Agnela, katham vikurṣe! 69 Paśya yathā tvam adhunā na dve naikaśca asi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Già eran li due capi un divenuti, 71 quando n’apparver due figure miste 72 in una faccia, ov’ eran due perduti.
query.error: **English:** 70 The two ends were already becoming one, 71 when there appeared to us two figures, 72 mixed in one face, where there were two lost.
query.result: 70 Giyātau dvau śirobhāgau ekena bhūtau, 71 Yatra nau adṛśyete dve mūrtau miśre, 72 Ekamukhe, yatra dvau naṣṭau āstām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Fersi le braccia due di quattro liste; 74 le cosce con le gambe e ’l ventre e ’l casso 75 divenner membra che non fuor mai viste.
query.error: **English:** 73 He made two arms out of four branches; 74 his legs and thighs and belly and chest 75 became limbs that had never been seen before.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Ogne primaio aspetto ivi era casso: 77 due e nessun l’imagine perversa 78 parea; e tal sen gio con lento passo.
query.error: **English:** 76 Every primal aspect there was void: 77 two and none seemed the perverse image 78 and thus it went with slow pace.
query.result: 76 Sarvam ādyam rūpam tatra śūnyam āsīt: 77 Dve ca na caivam viparītam rūpam 78 Abhāsata; evam ca jagāma mandena padakrameṇa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Come ’l ramarro sotto la gran fersa 80 dei dì canicular, cangiando sepe, 81 folgore par se la via attraversa,
query.error: **English:** 79 Like the lizard under the great scourge 80 of the dog days, changing hedges, 81 seems like lightning if it crosses the path,
query.result: 79 Yathā śīta-kāle śīta-tapo-vidhūta-nidrāḥ 80 sarpaḥ svayam-āśrayam parityajya 81 vidyut-sadṛśaḥ pathi pradarśitaḥ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 sì pareva, venendo verso l’epe 83 de li altri due, un serpentello acceso, 84 livido e nero come gran di pepe;
query.error: **English:** 82 so it seemed, coming toward the edge 83 of the other two, a little snake, fiery, 84 livid and black as a peppercorn;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 e quella parte onde prima è preso 86 nostro alimento, a l’un di lor trafisse; 87 poi cadde giuso innanzi lui disteso.
query.error: **English:** 85 and that part where our nourishment is first taken, 86 it pierced one of them; 87 then it fell down, stretched out before him.
query.result: 85 yasya ca āhāra-grahaṇārtham mukham 86 tatraikaṃ tad-vaktram viṣaṇena viddhavān 87 sa ca tasya purastād bhūmau patitaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Lo trafitto ’l mirò, ma nulla disse; 89 anzi, co’ piè fermati, sbadigliava 90 pur come sonno o febbre l’assalisse.
query.error: **English:** 88 I looked at the pierced one, but he said nothing; 89 instead, with his feet still, he yawned 90 just as if sleep or fever were attacking him.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Elli ’l serpente e quei lui riguardava; 92 l’un per la piaga e l’altro per la bocca 93 fummavan forte, e ’l fummo si scontrava.
query.error: **English:** 91 They, the serpent and he, were looking at each other; 92 one through the wound and the other through the mouth 93 were fuming strongly, and the smoke clashed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Taccia Lucano ormai là dov’ e’ tocca 95 del misero Sabello e di Nasidio, 96 e attenda a udir quel ch’or si scocca.
query.error: **English:** 94 Let Lucan now be silent where he touches 95 on the wretched Sabellus and Nasidius, 96 and attend to hear what is now being shot forth.
query.result: 94 Tacet Lucanus nunc ubi tangit 95 Śabellum duḥkhitam ca Nāsidiyam, 96 śṛṇotu ca yat tad idānīm praharati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Taccia di Cadmo e d’Aretusa Ovidio, 98 ché se quello in serpente e quella in fonte 99 converte poetando, io non lo ’nvidio;
query.error: **English:** 97 Let Ovid be silent about Cadmus and Arethusa, 98 for if he, in his poetry, transformed the former into a serpent and the latter into a fountain, I do not envy him; 99 for never did he transmute two natures face to face

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 ché due nature mai a fronte a fronte 101 non trasmutò sì ch’amendue le forme 102 a cambiar lor matera fosser pronte.
query.error: **English:** 100 that two natures never face to face 101 so transformed each other that both forms 102 were ready to change their matter.
query.result: 100 yataḥ dve prakṛitī na kadācit api abhimukhe 101 anyonyam vivartatām yathā ubhe api rūpe 102 svayam vipariṇamate svakīyaṃ vastu kṛtum udyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Insieme si rispuosero a tai norme, 104 che ’l serpente la coda in forca fesse, 105 e ’l feruto ristrinse insieme l’orme.
query.error: **English:** 103 Together they responded to your commands, 104 so that the serpent made its tail into a fork, 105 and the wounded one drew its tracks together.
query.result: 103 Ekatraiva tebhyaḥ pratyuttaram adaduḥ, 104 yathā sarpaḥ puccham śaktyā cakāra, 105 tataś ca āhataḥ svakīyaṃ padavīṃ samāharati sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Le gambe con le cosce seco stesse 107 s’appiccar sì, che ’n poco la giuntura 108 non facea segno alcun che si paresse.
query.error: **English:** 106 His legs with his thighs were so stuck together 107 that at the joint no sign of their separation could be seen.
query.result: 106 Janghe ca ūru ca sahaivābhyām 107 Api caika eva babhūvatu, yathā alpam api sandhiḥ 108 Na dṛśyate, yaḥ svayam eva dṛśyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Togliea la coda fessa la figura 110 che si perdeva là, e la sua pelle 111 si facea molle, e quella di là dura.
query.error: **English:** 109 The forked tail took away the form 110 that was lost there, and its skin 111 became soft, and that of the other hard.
query.result: 109 Viṣamaṃ pṛṣṭhaṃ rūpaṃ jahāra 110 Yattatra naṣṭam āsīt, tasya ca tvak 111 Mṛduvatī abhavat, anyasya ca kaṭhinī.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Io vidi intrar le braccia per l’ascelle, 113 e i due piè de la fiera, ch’eran corti, 114 tanto allungar quanto accorciavan quelle.
query.error: **English:** 112 I saw him seize the other by the arm-pits, 113 and with his teeth he so crushed his legs, 114 that they dangled down like broken withes.
query.result: 112 Aham apaśyam tam hastābhyām bāhubhyām antar gataṃ, 113 Tasyāśca mṛgasya pādāv ubhau kharve, 114 Tāvān pradarśayām āsa yāvān hrasitau āsītām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Poscia li piè di rietro, insieme attorti, 116 diventaron lo membro che l’uom cela, 117 e ’l misero del suo n’avea due porti.
query.error: **English:** 115 Then his feet, twisted together behind, 116 became the member that a man conceals, 117 and the wretch had two outlets for his filth.
query.result: 115 Tataḥ padau pṛṣṭhataḥ, saha āvṛtau, 116 babhūvatuḥ sa aṅgaḥ yaṃ naraḥ guhāyati, 117 ca api daridraḥ tasya dve dvāre āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Mentre che ’l fummo l’uno e l’altro vela 119 di color novo, e genera ’l pel suso 120 per l’una parte e da l’altra il dipela,
query.error: **English:** 118 While the smoke veils the one and the other 119 with a new color, and generates the hair above 120 on one side and the other, it uncurls it,
query.result: 118 Yāvad dhūmenaikaṃ ca anyacca 119 navaṃ varṇaṃ prachādayati, ca utpādayati roma upari 120 ekena bhāgena ca anyena ca vikṣipati,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 l’un si levò e l’altro cadde giuso, 122 non torcendo però le lucerne empie, 123 sotto le quai ciascun cambiava muso.
query.error: **English:** 121 one rose up and the other fell down, 122 not turning, however, the wicked lamps, 123 under which each one changed face.
query.result: 121 ekaḥ utthitaḥ ca anyaḥ patitaḥ adhaḥ, 122 na vikṣipantaḥ tu tāḥ dīpāḥ pāpāḥ, 123 yasya adhaḥ ekaikaḥ vikurute vaktram.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Quel ch’era dritto, il trasse ver’ le tempie, 125 e di troppa matera ch’in là venne 126 uscir li orecchi de le gote scempie;
query.error: **English:** 124 That which was straight, he twisted toward his temples, 125 and from too much matter that came there, 126 the ears emerged from the smooth cheeks;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 ciò che non corse in dietro e si ritenne 128 di quel soverchio, fé naso a la faccia 129 e le labbra ingrossò quanto convenne.
query.error: **English:** 127 that which did not run back and was retained 128 of that excess, made a nose for the face 129 and thickened the lips as much as was fitting.
query.result: 127 yaḥ tu punaḥ na pratyāvartata, api tu sthitaḥ eva, 128 tena atiriktāt nāsikā mukhe jāta, 129 oṣṭhau ca yathā ucitam sthūle jāte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Quel che giacëa, il muso innanzi caccia, 131 e li orecchi ritira per la testa 132 come face le corna la lumaccia;
query.error: **English:** 130 That which lay, thrusts its snout forward, 131 and draws its ears back toward its head, 132 as a snail does its horns;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 e la lingua, ch’avëa unita e presta 134 prima a parlar, si fende, e la forcuta 135 ne l’altro si richiude; e ’l fummo resta.
query.error: **English:** 133 and the tongue, which it had single and quick 134 to speak before, it splits, and the forked 135 part closes back into the other; and the smoke remains.
query.result: 133 Jihvā ca, yā tasyaikā tvariṣṭā āsīt 134 Pūrvam bhāṣaṇāya, sa vihanyate, Dvividhā ca 135 Anyatra saṃyujyate; dhūmaś ca tiṣṭhati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 L’anima ch’era fiera divenuta, 137 suffolando si fugge per la valle, 138 e l’altro dietro a lui parlando sputa.
query.error: **English:** 136 The soul that had become proud, 137 panting, flees through the valley, 138 and the other, speaking, spits after him.
query.result: 136 Ātmā yaḥ abhimānī babhūva, 137 śvāsam kṛtvā palāyati upatyakām prati, 138 anyaś ca tasya paścāt kathyamānaḥ kṣipati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Poscia li volse le novelle spalle, 140 e disse a l’altro: «I’ vo’ che Buoso corra, 141 com’ ho fatt’ io, carpon per questo calle».
query.error: **English:** 139 Then he turned his new shoulders to them, 140 and said to the other: "I want Buoso to run, 141 as I have done, on all fours along this path."
query.result: 139 Tataḥ sa navaṃ skandham tebhyaḥ apavartayat, 140 anyam ca avocat: "Icchami Buasam dhāvati, 141 yathāham cakāra, carpaṇam anena mārgeṇa."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 Così vid’ io la settima zavorra 143 mutare e trasmutare; e qui mi scusi 144 la novità se fior la penna abborra.
query.error: **English:** 142 Thus I saw the seventh ballast 143 change and transform; and here may the novelty 144 excuse me if my pen shuns flowers.
query.result: 142 Evam aham saptamīṃ dhātum 143 parivartante parivartante ca apaśyam; atra ca mām kṣamantām 144 nautanyam yadi puṣpaṃ lekhanī vihātum icchati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
145 E avvegna che li occhi miei confusi 146 fossero alquanto e l’animo smagato, 147 non poter quei fuggirsi tanto chiusi,
query.error: **English:** 145 And although my eyes were somewhat confused 146 and my mind was bewildered, 147 they could not flee so hidden,
query.result: 145 Api ca yadyapi me cakṣuṣī vyākulitau 146 āsītām alpaṃ ca manaḥ sammūḍham, 147 na śaknute tau palāyitum tāvad āvṛtau,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
151 l’altr’ era quel che tu, Gaville, piagni.
query.error: **English:** 151 the other was he whom you, Gaville, mourn.
query.result: 151 anyaḥ sa āsīt yaṃ tvam, Gāville, roṣasi.
